messages.subject: Re: Unschooling Sleep Poll
messages.msgSnippet: ... I was like that, too, as a teen - even earlier if I could manage it. When my brother started driving I d go to bed right after dinner and he d wake me a
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Professional Parenting"
<jarnall@...> wrote:
>
> How do I keep my 16 year old up?
> He goes to bed every night at 10!

I was like that, too, as a teen - even earlier if I could manage it.
When my brother started driving I'd go to bed right after dinner and
he'd wake me a few hours later to take the car out after our parents
fell asleep. Different bodies have different rhythms. Why do you *want*
him up? Is that a joke?

---Meredith (Mo 7, Ray 14)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Unschooling Sleep Poll
messages.msgSnippet: How do I keep my 16 year old up? He goes to bed every night at 10! Judy Arnall,  Peaceful Parenting Expert, Speaker and Author of Discipline Without Distress:
messages.messageBody:
How do I keep my 16 year old up?
He goes to bed every night at 10!
Judy Arnall, Peaceful Parenting Expert, Speaker and Author of "Discipline Without Distress: 135 tools for raising caring, responsible children without time-out, spanking, punishment or bribery" www.professionalparenting.ca Tele: (403) 714-6766 Email jarnall@... "Peace In The World Begins In The Home"



----- Original Message -----
From: Julie
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, September 06, 2008 1:56 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Unschooling Sleep Poll


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Julie" <julesmiel@...>
wrote:
> As a follow-up to my questions about what unschooled sleep looks
> like for other families, I have created a poll:
> http://www.misterpoll.com/polls/355934

For anyone who has tried to view poll results, you can see the last
two comment sections are not visible. I was able to view them when I
downloaded them, so I have posted them here:
http://familyrun.ning.com/forum/topic/show?id=2184370%3ATopic%3A25576

I will continue to check and post new comments. Thanks to all who
have responded--over 70 so far!

Julie B
Dmitri, 3
Halloweenish baby on the way
http://www.whitehawk.org

messages.messageBody:
As a follow-up to my questions about what unschooled sleep looks like
for other families, I have created a poll:
http://www.misterpoll.com/polls/355934

If you'd like to participate in creating a mosaic of what unschooled
sleep looks like, please respond. Thanks!

Julie B
Dmitri, 3
Halloweenish baby on the way
http://www.whitehawk.org
